    • Method Detail

      • addMedia

        public AssetResponse addMedia(Long accountId,
                     Long assetId,
                     Long albumId,
                     Long collectionId,
                     Enums.DefaultAlbumType addToDefaultAlbum,
                     String caption,
                     String locationDescription,
                     Location location,
                     String notificationMessage,
                     String mediaFilePath,
                     String attachedMediaFilePath,
                     String attachedMediaUrl)
                       throws SirqulException
        Uploads an asset to s3 server and returns an asset id which can be used to assign to various objects.

        Target API Endpoint: /asset/create
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        assetId - the asset id (optional) if you want to replace the asset but keep the same id, same permissions, same notes etc
        albumId - the album the asset will be added to (optional)
        collectionId - the collection id
        addToDefaultAlbum - the add to default album
        caption - the caption (optional)
        locationDescription - the location description (optional)
        location - the location (optional)
        notificationMessage - the notification message
        mediaFilePath - the media file path
        attachedMediaFilePath - the attached media file path containing an asset that the "media" file references (optional). Example to upload a video: the "media" file should contain a screen capture of the video, and the "attachedMedia" should be the actual video.
        attachedMediaUrl - this can be used if the "attachedMedia" is a link (i.e. a Youtube video, etc) (optional)
        Returns:
        a AssetResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • addMediaFinished

        public SirqulResponse addMediaFinished(Long accountId,
                              Long albumId,
                              List<Long> assetIds)
                                throws SirqulException
        Triggers a notification to be sent to all album participants when a user add assets to an album.

        Target API Endpoint: /consumer/media/add/finished
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        albumId - the album id
        assetIds - list of asset IDs that have been added
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • getMedia

        public AssetFullResponse getMedia(Long accountId,
                         Long assetId,
                         Boolean noteDescending)
                           throws SirqulException
        Gets the full asset response including attached likes and notes.

        Target API Endpoint: /asset/get
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId sent automatically)
        assetId - the asset ID
        noteDescending - determines whether the notes on the asset are in descending order
        Returns:
        a AssetFullResponse on valid response, or SirqulResponse with error message
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • removeMedia

        public SirqulResponse removeMedia(Long accountId,
                         Long albumId,
                         Long collectionId,
                         Long contestId,
                         Boolean removeFromAssetList2,
                         Long assetId,
                         Boolean removeFromDefaultAlbums,
                         Location location)
                           throws SirqulException
        Remove an asset from collections and or set the asset to deleted/inactive

        Target API Endpoint: /asset/delete.
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required)
        albumId - the album id to remove the asset from
        collectionId - the collection id to remove the asset from
        contestId - the contest id to remove the asset from
        removeFromAssetList2 - for contests, determines whether to remove from the first asset list or the second asset list
        assetId - the id of the asset to remove
        removeFromDefaultAlbums - determines whether to remove from default albums
        location - the location, used to update the user's current location
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.

      • updateMedia

        public SirqulResponse updateMedia(Long accountId,
                         Long assetId,
                         Long albumId,
                         Long attachedAssetId,
                         String caption,
                         String locationDescription,
                         Location location)
                           throws SirqulException
        Updates an asset's meta data. If an album reference is passed in, the participants with write permissions are allowed to edit the asset. Otherwise, only the asset up-loader has permission to edit the data.

        Target API Endpoint: /asset/update
        Parameters:
        accountId - the account ID of the user (deviceId or accountId required, deviceId is sent automatically)
        assetId - the ID of the asset to update
        albumId - the ID of the album to check user permissions
        attachedAssetId - the ID of the attached asset
        caption - the caption
        locationDescription - the location description
        location - the location used to update the asset's location
        Returns:
        a SirqulResponse with a message of success or fail
        Throws:
        SirqulException - the SirqulException. A custom exception type specifically thrown by this Sirqul SDK.
